data.template_howto: This interaction will present the learner with a scenario and ask them a question with multiple choice answers. Feedback will be displayed for incorrect answers. Selecting the correct answer will jump to the second slide with feedback presented. You can choose 1-5 scenarios. Make sure you complete all the information on all slides.

variable.editable: Make Required>>text::Required?::multichoice==true{{false>>To make this interaction required select 'true'. Don't forget to remove the mark complete call from your html page.
variable.name: required_flag
variable.text: <notrans>true</notrans>

variable.editable: Number of Scenarios>>text::Number of Scenarios::multichoice==1{{2{{3{{4{{5>>Select the number of scenarios.
variable.name: scenario_num

variable.editable: Scenario Text>>text::Scenario Text::textarea>>Enter a description of the scenario and the question you would like to ask.
variable.name: scenario_text_1
variable.text:
Zahir is curious about whether he can change what double-tapping one of his AirPods does.

Can Zahir change what double-tapping does?

variable.editable: Correct Answer>>text::Correct Answer::multichoice==A{{B{{C>>Select the letter of the correct answer choice.
variable.name: correct_answer
variable.text: A

variable.editable: Answer A Feedback>>text::Answer A Feedback::textarea>>Enter the feedback for answer A. Keep the feedback short as there is not much room to display it. The feedback will display in a dialog below the instructions. This feedback will not show in the preview below.
variable.name: a_feedback_text
variable.text: Correct! Zahir can change what double-tapping does by tapping the name of AirPods from Settings > Bluetooth.

variable.editable: Answer B Feedback>>text::Answer B Feedback::textarea>>Enter the feedback for answer B. Keep the feedback short as there is not much room to display it. The feedback will display in a dialog below the instructions. This feedback will not show in the preview below.
variable.name: b_feedback_text
variable.text: Incorrect. Zahir can use the Siri settings in the Settings app to change what Siri does. However, the Siri settings don't affect the functionality of AirPods. Try again.

variable.editable: Answer C Feedback>>text::Answer C Feedback::textarea>>Enter the feedback for answer C. Keep the feedback short as there is not much room to display it. The feedback will display in a dialog below the instructions. This feedback will not show in the preview below.
variable.name: c_feedback_text
variable.text: Incorrect. Double-tap is the only gesture control. Try again.

html.editable: Answer A>>text::Answer A::textarea>>Enter the text for Answer A. Be careful not to enter too much text and overflow the bounds.
html.text: Yes, Zahir can change the setting by tapping the name of his AirPods from Settings > Bluetooth.

html.editable: Answer B>>text::Answer B::textarea>>Enter the text for Answer B. Be careful not to enter too much text and overflow the bounds.
html.text: Yes, Zahir can change the setting from Settings > Siri.

html.editable: Answer C>>text::Answer C::textarea>>Enter the text for Answer C. Be careful not to enter too much text and overflow the bounds.
html.text: No, Zahir cannot change what double-tapping does.

html.editable: Finished Feedback>>text::Finished Feedback::textarea
html.text: Correct! Zahir can change what double-tapping does by tapping the name of his AirPods from Settings > Bluetooth.

variable.editable: Scenario Text>>text::Scenario Text::textarea>>Enter a description of the scenario. Only use this area for the sceneario. Enter the question you would like to ask in the question area below.
variable.name: scenario_text_2
variable.text:
Diego was running, and one of his AirPods fell out of his ear. Playback was immediately paused, and Diego is concerned that his AirPods might have been damaged.

What should you tell Diego?

variable.editable: Correct Answer>>text::Correct Answer::multichoice==A{{B{{C>>Select the letter of the correct answer choice.
variable.name: correct_answer
variable.text: C

variable.editable: Answer A Feedback>>text::Answer A Feedback::textarea>>Enter the feedback for answer A. Keep the feedback short as there is not much room to display it. The feedback will display in a dialog below the instructions. This feedback will not show in the preview below.
variable.name: a_feedback_text
variable.text: Incorrect. Although incoming calls automatically pause playback, Diego told you that one of his AirPods fell out of his ear. Try again.

variable.editable: Answer B Feedback>>text::Answer B Feedback::textarea>>Enter the feedback for answer B. Keep the feedback short as there is not much room to display it. The feedback will display in a dialog below the instructions. This feedback will not show in the preview below.
variable.name: b_feedback_text
variable.text: Incorrect. Although the individual battery charge can affect playback, Diego told you that one of his AirPods fell out of his ear. Try again.

variable.editable: Answer C Feedback>>text::Answer C Feedback::textarea>>Enter the feedback for answer C. Keep the feedback short as there is not much room to display it. The feedback will display in a dialog below the instructions. This feedback will not show in the preview below.
variable.name: c_feedback_text
variable.text: Correct! AirPods can detect when they are in a user's ears. When one of the AirPods fell out of Diego's ear, playback was automatically paused. Audio playback resumes when Diego has both AirPods in his ears.

html.editable: Answer A>>text::Answer A::textarea>>Enter the text for Answer A. Be careful not to enter too much text and overflow the bounds.
html.text: "Your iPhone might have had an incoming call. Incoming calls automatically pause playback."

html.editable: Answer B>>text::Answer B::textarea>>Enter the text for Answer B. Be careful not to enter too much text and overflow the bounds.
html.text: "AirPods might not have been fully charged when you removed them from the charging case. Open the lid of the charging case, and check the color of the LED."

html.editable: Answer C>>text::Answer C::textarea>>Enter the text for Answer C. Be careful not to enter too much text and overflow the bounds.
html.text: "AirPods sense when they are in your ears. If one of the AirPods isn't in your ear, or is removed, playback automatically pauses until you return it to your ear."

html.editable: Finished Feedback>>text::Finished Feedback::textarea
html.text:
Correct! AirPods can detect when they are in a user's ears. When one of the AirPods fell out of Diego's ear, playback was automatically paused. Diego can resume his audio by returning one of the AirPods to his ear.

You have completed this interaction.
